The bottom line is that the current generation of GMOs primarily promote chemical-intensive industrial agriculture and corporate profits rather than public health or environmental sustainability. They haven't lived up to the hype of solving world hunger or reducing pesticide use.

To truly improve the food supply, we need to invest in more ecological approaches like agroecology, organic farming, and plant breeding methods that don't involve risky genetic engineering. GMOs are a technological fix that fails to address the root causes of our unsustainable food system.
